editionStmt.funder: Conversion of the printed catalogue to TEI funded by the Warden and Fellows of Merton College .

msItem.note: Fols. iv-v blank. The table of contents, s. xv, on f. vv shows that after f. 60 are missing the last six books of art. 1, and ‘Epistola Lincolniensis ad magistrum Adam Rufum quod Deus est forma prima omnium creatorum’ (Epist. 1), ‘Epistola eiusdem ad comitissam Wyntonie de Iudeis non molestandis’ (Epist. 5), ‘Tractatus secundum [?Bacon smudged] de utilitate astronomie et operacione fidei’ (prob. Ps.-ALBERTUS MAGNUS, Speculum Astronomiae; Glorieux, Théol. 6dj; eTK 0975J), and from the end ‘Conclusiones textuales ... super libros de anima cum earum probaciones et mediis’.

msItem.author: Ps.-ROBERT GROSSETESTE
msItem.title: Summa Philosophiae
msItem.rubric: Incipit tractatus difficilium ad scientiam ueram uniuersaliter inspectancium ...
msItem.explicit: (ends impf. in xii. 14) quia lineabus per directionem (catchwords linee ab)
msItem.note: Pr. without place 1498, Venice 1552 &c.; Thomson, Grosseteste, pp. 265–6; eTK 1040B.

At the foot of f. 1 is a couplet, s. xv: ‘Anni cum Domini transissent mille ducenti
Quinquaginta duo uero transiit iste sequenti’, labelled ‘Robertus’.

msItem.title: ‘Conclusiones textuales’ on ARISTOTLE, Physics
msItem.incipit: (Beg. impf. in ii. 8) Dignius autem est quod principia sunt finita et contraria; Prima questio quod melius et dignius est ponere principia finita
msItem.explicit: magnitudinem esse infinitam. Infinitum quasi igitur &c. Explicit &c.

msItem.title: ‘Conclusiones textuales’ on ARISTOTLE, De Generatione et Corruptione
msItem.rubric: Hic incipit primus liber de generacione.
msItem.incipit: De generacione &c. Prima questio. Quia intendit in hoc libro s. de generacione et corrupcione de natura generatorum
msItem.explicit: (ends impf. in ii. 2 q. 3) in aqua frigiditas terre (catchword) siccitas.

supportDesc.extent:
104 leaves (v + 99) 260 180
185 110
All edges retrimmed and spattered red. Contemporary foliation runs 1–60, 114–49.
supportDesc.collation: A bifolium, 1–812; catchwords. After 5 are missing four quires of 12 and a quaternion; more quires are missing from the end.

layoutDesc.layout: Ruled with pencil in 2 cols of 48 lines.

handDesc.handNote: A single English gothic rotunda bookhand, using pale ink. Running heads between specially ruled lines.

decoDesc.decoNote: On f. 1 an initial P in pink, blue and gold, with full vine-leaf border, enclosing the mitred bust of Grosseteste; red and blue flourished initials with partial borders; blue initials flourished in red; red or blue paraphs.

binding.p: Standard Merton s. xvii, repaired and rebacked; sewn on four bands; formerly chained from the usual position. Fols. i and 99 are modern paper blanks, ii-iii, 97–9 paper binding leaves, s. xvii, fols. ii and 98 from the same printed book as in MS 68. On f. iv, pasted down to an earlier binding, is the mark of a brass chain-staple near the foot of the foredge; on fols. v and 1 are rust-stains in the same position.

history.provenance: At the College by c. 1600; the James no. ‘16’ (wrongly) is at the head of f. vv.
Inside the front board is a sheet of paper with the contents, s. xvii, and ‘Q. 3. 12. Art:’, canc. and replaced with ‘H. 3. 10 (CCCX)’ in red; the College bookplate. ‘12’ is inked on the foredge.

source.bibl: R. M. Thomson, A descriptive catalogue of the medieval manuscripts of Merton College, Oxford (Cambridge: D. S. Brewer), 2009.

availability.p: For enquiries relating to this manuscript please contact Merton College Library.

listBibl.bibl: Coxe, p. 123; Powicke, no. 1236; Alexander & Temple, no. 351 and pl. XXIV.
